answerText: Mars[10] This former tallest mountain in the Solar System is the tallest volcano on Mars.
heading: MUT |2015 | 8 | 11 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: A hypothesis about the crustal dichotomy on this planet centers on a single large impact forming the Borealis basin, which restarted volcanic activity and formed the Tharsis bulge [10] Name this planet with a "dramatic" topographic and geologic dichotomy between the northern, lowland third of its crust and the southern, upland two-thirds of its crust
